thread.title: Yankees notes: Michael Pineda pulled early - Yankees
thread.title_full: Yankees notes: Michael Pineda pulled early - Yankees - NorthJersey.com

author: PETE CALDERA
title: Yankees notes: Michael Pineda pulled early - Yankees
text:
BALTIMORE — With home-field advantage in the wild card at stake heading into his start, Michael Pineda lasted just 3 2/3 innings — removed after 83 pitches in Sunday’s regular-season finale at Camden Yards. "Right now, I don’t feel pretty good," Pineda said of his performance in Baltimore’s 9-4 win.
The Yanks will host Tuesday’s wild card against Houston due to the Astros’ loss Sunday at Arizona, but that was an uncertainty when Pineda exited with a man on and the Yanks trailing, 3-1.
Chris Capuano relieved and yielded an odd double by Ryan Flaherty that deflected off the lefty’s leg and past second baseman Dustin Ackley. Two batters later, Gerardo Parra’s two-run single made it 5-1 and manager Joe Girardi would call on seven more relievers.
"I didn’t think he threw horrible," Girardi said of Pineda. "The thing was, he’d thrown so many pitches. "If we’re going to do anything in this [postseason], he has to be good and I don’t want to wear him down. That’s why I took him out. … I’ve got to protect him."
Pineda blamed faulty command of his slider for his early troubles, but he had it working later (no walks, five strikeouts). The right-hander added that he feels strong physically. "[I’m] a little mad, a little angry," at yielding four runs on six hits.
TANAKA TIME: Masahiro Tanaka threw a normal between-starts bullpen in preparation for Tuesday’s wild-card start, on his customary sixth day. "I know how important the game is," Tanaka said through his interpreter. "I just want to go out there and do my best, be able to contribute to the team’s win so we can advance to our next step."
BRIEFS: Girardi’s next step is to finalize a wild-card roster that is wholly different than any he’s done previously, since it’s a one-game format. The Yankees will hold a workout at the Stadium this afternoon. … Justin Wilson and Andrew Miller each pitched one-third of an inning as a tuneup. Dellin Betances was rested.
Email: caldera@northjersey.com
